intro: Chonemorpha antidysenterica, commonly known as the dysentery plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its traditional use in treating digestive ailments, it has garnered attention for its potential medicinal properties.
